DataElement.preferredName: Person Adverse Event Assessment Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A response to determine eligibility for clinical trial participation as outlined in the study protocol for questions related to assessments of the patient's unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Adverse Event Assessment Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A human being._Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s)._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Property.preferredName: Adverse Event Assessment Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).:The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).
The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does patient have any prior G
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have any prior Grade greater than or equal to 3 immune-related adverse event (irAE) while receiving any previous immunotherapy agent, or any unresolved irAE greater than Grade 1?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of grade 3 and 4 pulmonary, CNS and renal events attributed to anti-CTLA-4 agents?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have unresolved toxicities from prior anti-tumor therapy, defined as not having resolved to CTCAE v 4.0 grade 0 or 1, or to levels dictated in the eligibility criteria with the exception of alopecia (Grade 2 or 3 toxicities from prior antitumor therapy that are considered irreversible [defined as having been present and stable for greater than 6 months], such as ifosfamide-related proteinuria, may be allowed if they are not otherwise described in the exclusion criteria AND there is agreement to allow by both the investigator and sponsor)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient adequately recovered from any adverse events resulting from prior anti-neoplastic treatment including chemotherapy, biological therapy, targeted small molecule therapy, radiation therapy, and surgery as determined by the investigator [and in consultation with the study PI]?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have unresolved toxicities from prior anti-tumor therapy, defined as not having resolved to CTCAE v 5.0 grade 0 or 1, or to levels dictated in the eligibility criteria with the exception of alopecia (Grade 2 or 3 toxicities from prior antitumor therapy that are considered irreversible [defined as having been present and stable for > 6 months], such as ifosfamide-related proteinuria, may be allowed if they are not otherwise described in the exclusion criteria AND there is agreement to allow by both the investigator and sponsor)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient had a malignancy within the past 3 years for which prostatectomy is a contraindication?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient had prior CTLA-4 inhibitor treatment, did patient experience serious adverse events?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient developed erythema nodosum characterized by a desquamating rash while taking thalidomide, lenalidomide, or similar drugs in the past?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient experience greater than or equal to serious grade 3 irAE (excluding endocrinopathies) during previous treatment with one of the checkpoint inhibitors?
